```{r}
#Part 1

rm(list = ls())
#Parameters
PNa <- 1
PK <- 20
PCl <- 5
Na0 <- 460 #mM
K0 <- 10 #mM
Cl0 <- 540 #mM
Nai <- 50 #mM
Ki <- 400 #mM
Cli <- 100 #mM
R <- 8.314 #J/mol-K
T <- 310 #K
F <- 96500 #coul/mol
#Function
GHK_func <- function(){
  MemPot <- ((R*T)/F)*log(((PNa*Na0)+(PK*K0)+(PCl*Cli))/((PNa*Nai)+(PK*Ki)+(PCl*Cl0)))
  return(MemPot*1000)
}
#Call Function
Erev <- GHK_func()
Erev
#Question 1:
#We call this membrane potential the reversal potential. This involves all of the ions present in the situation.

#Question 2: 
#Erev is calculated to be -59.47 V.

#Question 3:
#We call this value of the membrane potential to be the resting potential.
```
